Many investigations indicated that the probability density curves of the SAT shift to the right side with increasing global warming, indicating an increase in the mean SAT associated with more frequent occurrences of very hot and extremely hot weather. The shape of the curves widens, suggesting the enlargement of the standard deviation of the SAT [ 2].
